availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Campbell County, Kentucky, native. Son of Ira Root and Sarah Perry Root. Attended school in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Graduated from Miami University in Butler County, Ohio, in 1858. Attorney in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Graduated from Cincinnati Law School in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1861. County attorney for Campbell County, Kentucky, from 1861 to 1865. Served in the 42nd Enrolled Militia (U.S.A.) as a private from September 2, 1862, to September 27, 1862.
